result.execSummary:
The defendant Johnny Webster Heard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Consecutive to current sentence  May be served in Wisconsin State Prison.

Pay mandatory DNA fee, all couert costs, fees and surcharges.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil  judgment being entered.
Payment plan for all monetary obligations to be established by DOC, probation and parole.  All unpaid balances stil due and owing at the end of the two years after release to Extended supervision  in current case serving and to which this sentence is to be served consecutively, will convert to a civil judgment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Johnny Webster Heard

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Due date amended in CCAP based on  confirmation from Dodge Correctional: defendant's anticipated release date is 4/25/2015.
Of Right To Seek Postconviction Relief, FILED.

Defendant Johnny Webster Heard in court with attorney Vincent P Guimont.  Defendant Johnny Webster Heard in custody.  Michael Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
-  AMENDED INFORMATION, FILED.
COUNT 1 AMENDED to Obstructing/Resisting An Officer, contrary to 946.41(1), 939.51(3)(a), Wisconsin Stats, a CLASS A MISDEMEANOR.

AS TO COUNT 1, Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the AMENDED information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Sentencing proceeds.  Statements made by the state, defense counsel and defendant. 

Defendant sentenced to serve 4 months at the HOUSE OF CORRECTION, CONSECUTIVE to Current Sentence. Sentence may be served in Wisconsin State Prison.  Credit for ZERO days time served. 
.
CONDITIONS:
-pay MANDATORY DNA Fee; failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered;
-pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges; failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered;
-
-  Payment Plan for all monetary obligations to be established by Department of Corrections, Probation and Parole.  All unpaid balances still due and owing at the end of two years after released to extended supervision in current case serving, and to which this sentence is to be served consecutively, will convert to a civil judgment.
-  Civil Judgment Warning given.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter.  

Appeal rights given. Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed. Copy given to defendant.

Attorney Vincent P Guimont in court, defendant Johnny Webster Heard not in court, in custody.  Michael Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 05-28-2014 at 01:30 pm.

Certification of transcript of proceedings of PRELIMINARY HEARING  commencing APRIL 1, 2014  received and filed. (22 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to  Vincent Guimont - ASPD  819 N 6th Street  Milwaukee, WI  53203.

Defendant Johnny Webster Heard in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Johnny Webster Heard in custody.  Janet Protasiewicz for Michael Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Karl Simandl-Village of Shorewood Police Department Sargeant.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 5, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Johnny Webster Heard in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Johnny Webster Heard in custody.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 1, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
